page.title: 11Burton Before 1939
page.content: Before the 2nd World War there were few roads in Burton.The roads that I remember are the High St.and Normanby Rd.The land,apart from a few houses, was mainly fields.Now new houses have been built so there are more streets. In 1940 all children received their education in the new school,but before 1940 girls went to school near the church and boys went to school in Normanby.Transport for the boys was only a horse drawn cart.On Sundays children had to dress in their best clothes for church and when they arrived home they changed.The only transport there would be in Burton was a horse drawn bus and it would take about an hour to get to Scunthorpe. When women went shopping they went mostly in the evening,they went to the market because it was cheaper.
